alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Castro; Floyd; Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Swisher (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 8:54PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...Strong outflow wind gusts will impact portions of northwestern Lubbock, northwestern Floyd, northern Hockley, Hale, eastern Castro, Swisher, western Briscoe and Lamb Counties through 930 PM CDT... At 851 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong outflow boundary along a line extending from Happy to Olton to Amherst. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar and West Texas Mesonet indicated. Several mesonet stations across the southern Texas Panhandle have recorded wind gusts in excess of 50 mph as the outflow boundary passes. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Plainview, Littlefield, Tulia, Abernathy, Hale Center, Olton, Hart, Silverton, Shallowater, Lockney, Petersburg, Anton, Sudan, Amherst, Kress, Happy, Cotton Center, Vigo Park, Fieldton and Spade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Not all locations will receive rainfall, but if outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Consider securing outdoor items that may be damaged by strong wind gusts.

area.areaDesc: Briscoe; Castro; Floyd; Hale; Hockley; Lamb; Lubbock; Swisher
